data.title: Here are 9 golfers who have a good shot of winning the 40th U.S. Senior Open
authors: The South Bend Tribune, South Bend Tribune
data.meta_description: Plenty of firepower in this year's 156-player field at Notre Dame's Warren Golf Course
data.text:
David Toms

Age: 52

Height: 5-foot-10

Weight: 160 pounds

Birthplace: Monroe, La.

College: Louisiana State University

Resides: Shreveport, La.

Turned Pro: 1989

2019 scoring average: 69.32

2019 money won: $721,845

2019 Top 10 finishes: 5

Career PGA victories: 14

Career earnings: $41.8 million

Major accomplishments: The defending U.S. Senior Open champion had his best year in 2001 when he had nine top 10 finishes on the PGA Tour, including a major win in that year’s PGA Championship. His 72-hole score of 265 stood as the lowest in a major until Hendrik Stenson’s 264 in the 2016 Open Championship. Toms has also played on three U.S. Ryder Cup teams as well as four President’s Cup teams.

Scott McCarron

Age: 53

Height: 5-foot-10

Weight: 170 pounds

Birthplace: Sacramento, Calif.

College: UCLA (1988)

Resides: Mooresville, N.C.

Turned Pro: 1992

2019 scoring average: 69.58

2019 money won: $1,766,211 (first on tour)

2019 Top 10 finishes: 8 (first at MasterCard Japan Championship, Insperity Invitational and Mitsubishi Electric Classic)

Career PGA victories: 14

Career earnings: $20.9 million

Major accomplishments: A two-time winner of the PGA Tour’s BellSouth Classic (1997, 2001).

Bernard Langer

Age: 61

Height: 5-foot-9

Weight: 160 pounds

Birthplace: Anhausen, Germany

Resides: Boca Raton, Fla.

Turned pro: 1972

2019 scoring average: 69.27

2019 money won: $773,154

2019 Top 10 finishes: 5 (one first)

Career PGA Tour victories: 39

Career earnings: $38.2 million

Major accomplishments: Two time Master’s champion (1985, 1993)

Miguel Ångel Jiménez

Age: 55

Height: 5-foot-10

Weight: 180 pounds

Birthplace/resides: Malaga, Spain

Turned Pro: 1982

2019 scoring average: 70.48

2019 money won: $415,134

2019 Top 10 finishes: 1 (won the Chubb Classic

Career PGA victories: 7

Career earnings: $10.4 million

Major accomplishments: Besides his seven career victories on the PGA Tour Champions including the 2018 Senior (British) Open Championship, Jiménez has 21 career international victories. He was also a member of four European Ryder Cup teams.

Paul Broadhurst

Age: 53

Height: 5-foot-11

Weight: 172 pounds

Birthplace: Walsall, England

Resides: Atherstone, England

Turned pro: 1988

2019 scoring average: 70.75

2019 money won: $522,609

2019 Top 10 finishes: 4 (finished third in the Senior PGA)

Career PGA victories: 5

Career earnings: $9.2 million

Major accomplishments: Was a member of the 1991 European Ryder Cup team. Has found success on the Champions Tour, winning the 2016 Senior (British) Open Championship and the 2018 Senior PGA Championship.

Steve Stricker

Age: 52

Height: 6-foot

Weight: 190 pounds

Birthplace: Edgerton, Wis.

College: University of Illinois

Resides: Madison, Wis.

Turned pro: 1990

2019 scoring average: 71.343

2019 money won: $135,670

2019 Top 10 finishes: None

Career PGA Tour victories: 12

Career earnings: $44 million

Major accomplishments: Spent more than 250 weeks in the World Golf Rankings, rising as high as No. 2 in September 2009.

Kirk Triplett

Age: 57

Height: 6-foot-3

Weight: 200 pounds

Birthplace: Moses Lake, Wash.

Resides: Scottsdale, Ariz.

Turned pro: 1985

2019 scoring average: 70.22

2019 money won: $935,169

2019 Top 10 finishes: 5

Career PGA victories: 10

Career earnings: $8.5 million

Major accomplishments: His best season on the PGA Tour was 2001 when he finished in the top 10 at the Master’s (T6), U.S. Open (T7) and PGA Championship (T10). He would again tie for sixth place at the Master’s in 2004.

Corey Pavin

Age: 59

Height: 5-foot-9

Weight: 155 pounds

Birthplace: Oxnard, Calif.

Resides: Dallas

Turned pro: 1982

2019 scoring average: 71.66

2019 money won: $325,757

2019 Top 10 finishes: 3

Career PGA victories: 16

Career earnings: $22.3 million

Major accomplishments: Pavin finished in the top 10 of major championships 12 times, winning the 1995 U.S. Open at Shinnecock Hills. He was the 1991 PGA Player of the Year.

Rocco Mediate

Age: 56

Height: 6-foot-1

Weight: 190 pounds

Birthplace: Greensburg, Pa.

College: Florida Southern

Resides: Naples, Fla.

Turned Pro: 1985

2019 scoring average: 71.62

2019 money won: $258,475

2019 Top 10 finishes: 2

Career PGA victories: 3

Career earnings: $21.2 million

Major accomplishments: Won the 2016 PGA Senior Championship at the Golf Club of Harbor Shores in Benton Harbor. Finished second to Tiger Woods in a Monday playoff in the 2008 U.S. Open at Torrey Pines.
